summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 9, 2019, coordinating logistics for New York agents traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss which FBI field offices cover specific Florida locations where victims are believed to be located.

persons.name: Torrance Slaughter
persons.context: An FBI agent on the desk in the Orlando area, copied on the email to provide interview assistance for Polk County.

persons.name: CT McGuiness
persons.context: The SSRA for the Lakeland Resident Agency, covering the Winter Garden area.

persons.name: Joe Boland
persons.context: The SSRA for the Pinellas Resident Agency, covering the Palm Harbor area.

events.title: FBI Coordination for Victim Interviews
events.description: FBI agents from New York coordinate with Tampa and Orlando field offices regarding travel to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims in the wake of Epstein's arrest and indictment.

events.title: Planned Start of Victim Interviews
events.description: New York FBI agents plan to begin interviewing victims in Florida, having flown down on the night of July 9.

keyFacts: The document is dated July 9, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment.
New York FBI agents were traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims related to the Epstein case.
Victims were located in multiple Florida areas: Miami, West Palm Beach, Winter Garden, and Palm Harbor.
The email chain shows inter-office FBI coordination between New York, Tampa, and Orlando field offices for the victim interview logistics.
The travel and interviews were a direct result of Epstein's arrest and indictment.
